newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING launches new investment fund.
newsitem.headline: ING launches new investment fund.

text.p: Financial services group ING said on Monday it was launching a new investment fund focusing on medium-capitalised Dutch listed companies.

The new ING Bank MidDutch Fund would cater to increased investor demand for so-call MidCap stocks, and aimed to offer 'clearly higher' long-term returns than those available to individuals investing direct, ING said.
Fund manager will be ING Investment Management, the biggest single investor in Dutch stocks, ING said.
Share subscriptions will run from September 20-27 at a price of 20 guilders per share, it said.
The fund will be admitted to listing on the Amsterdam Stock Exchange on October 1.
